name: Brouillon (Florian Hubert)
description:
Brouillon is a 2D toy seen from above representing a solar system. In this system, the player can place anomalies with a force of attraction or repulsion. These influence the trajectory of comets passing through the scene and others. Comets are attracted to a central sun of the scene and as soon as a comet approaches an anomaly its trajectory is completely changed. The player will thus be able place several anomalies in the game scene in order to upset the trajectory of comets, feeding the sun with these comets and playing with gravitational laws to create chaos in space game.

This experience is designed to be replayable to infinity and allow different behaviors/ways to play for the player such as feeding the sun to make it explode, avoiding the explosion of the sun, playing melody while creating anomalies, drawing using the trails of comets...

This is a student project made during the second year of bachelor of game design at ICAN, Paris. There are few levels but the development is likely to evolve.

___________________________________________________________________________

FEATURES :

  • The system is designed to enable the emergence of several gameplay
  • An original and clean graphic style
  • An interactive, scalable sound design based on the state of the system

___________________________________________________________________________

CONTROLS (only mouse and keyboard) : 

Gameplay :

  • Left Click to create an attractive anomaly
  • Right Click to create a repulsive anomaly

Debug : 

  • Enter to restart
  • P to  pause

___________________________________________________________________________
